means: 懒惰的，懒散的，不活跃的

word_mean: 无痛的：如无痛性肿瘤(indolent tumor)
生长缓慢的：如发展缓慢的病损(indolentlesion)

sentence.Network_en: He is old and fat and indolent.
The sultry weather in the tropics encourages tourists to lead an indolent life.
sentence.Network_cn: 热带闷热的气候使得游客只能过懒散的生活.

sentence.Network_en: I don't want to make friends with indolent persons.
sentence.Network_cn: 我不喜欢和懒惰的人交朋友。

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent.: from late Latin indolent-, from in- 'not' + dolere 'suffer or give pain'. The sense 'idle' arose in the early 18th cent

entry.tran: 懒惰的;怠惰的;好逸恶劳的
entry.def: Someone who is indolent is lazy.

example.ex: ...indolent teenagers who won't lift a finger to help.
example.tran: 懒惰的青少年们，连举手之劳都不愿意帮

sentences.sentence: "faineant kings under whose rule the country languished"
